generif.text: UTX associates with MLL3- and MLL4-containing histone H3 K4 methyltransferase complex(es) that also include ASH2L, RBBP5, WDR5, hDPY-30, PTIP, PA1, NCOA6.
the human JmjC-domain-containing proteins UTX and JMJD3 demethylate tri-methylated Lys 27 on histone H3

study shows that UTX is a di- and trimethyl H3K27 demethylase; results suggest a concerted mechanism for transcriptional activation in which cycles of H3K4 methylation by MLL2/3 are linked with the demethylation of H3K27 through UTX
critical role for UTX in regulating H3K27 methylation at the HOX gene loci and in animal posterior development
The JmjC domain-containing protein UTX specifically demethylates mono-, di- and trimethylated K27 of histone H3 in vitro.
UTX and JMJD3 may function as H3K27 demethylases in vivo
Here, we describe inactivating somatic mutations in the histone lysine demethylase gene UTX, pointing to histone H3 lysine methylation deregulation in multiple tumor types

identification of inactivating mutations in two genes--SETD2, a histone H3 lysine 36 methyltransferase, and JARID1C, a histone H3 lysine 4 demethylase--as well as mutations in the histone H3 lysine 27 demethylase, UTX in clear cell renal cell carcinoma
UTX removes H3K27me3 and maintains expression of several RB-binding proteins, enabling cell cycle arrest
Observational study of gene-disease association. (HuGE Navigator)
The role of the H3K27 demethylases Jmjd3 and UTX in gene expression, is discussed.
KDM6A- and KDM6B-responsive Homeobox genes are expressed at significantly higher levels, suggesting that HPV16 E7 results in reprogramming of host epithelial cells
UXT is a potential interactor of HBV Pol.
inhibition measurements showed significant selectivity between KDM4C and KDM6A
Novel UTX, DNMT3A, and EZH2 mutations were found in 8%, 10%, and 5.5% of patients with chronic myelomonocytic leukemia.
H3K27 demethylation by JMJD3 at a poised enhancer of anti-apoptotic gene BCL2 determines ERalpha ligand dependency
Correlating with the loss of H3K27me3, human papillomavirus 16 E6/E7-expressing cells exhibited derepression of specific EZH2-, KMD6A-, and BMI1-targeted HOX genes.
clarified how UTX discriminates H3K27me3/2 from the other methyllysines with distinct roles

This study identifies KDM6A mutations as another cause of Kabuki syndrome and highlights the growing role of histone methylases and histone demethylases in multiple-congenital-anomaly and intellectual-disability syndromes.
demonstrate that UTX directly associates with the promoters of the Mll1, Runx1, and Scl genes and modulate their transcription by controlling H3K27me3 marks on respective promoter regions.
PAN RNA interacts with demethylases JMJD3 and UTX, and the histone methyltransferase MLL2
identification of Utx as a novel mediator with distinct functions during the re-establishment of pluripotency and germ cell development
Microdeletions and microduplications have not been identified in the MLL2 and KDM6A genes of a large cohort of patients with Kabuki syndrome.
KDM6A contributes to the activation of WNT3 and DKK1 at different differentiation stages when WNT3 and DKK1 are required for mesendoderm and definitive endoderm differentiation.
This study demonistrated that KDM6A mutations were most commonly identified in subgroups in medulloblastoma.
KDM6A is overexpressed in breast cancer patients with an unfavorable prognosis (mortality at 1 year, p=8.65E-7).
UTX regulates stem cell migration and hematopoiesis.
UTX histone demethylase plays important functional role in epigenetic alteration of HOX clusters during retinoic acid-induced neural differentiation.
PBRM1, KDM6A, SETD2 and BAP1 were unmethylated in all tumor and normal specimens.
The identification of novel KDM6A mutations in patients with Kabuki syndrome.
Both Ezh2 and Kdm6a were shown to affect expression of master regulatory genes involved in adipogenesis and osteogenesis.
results demonstrate that UTX is implicated in IL-4 mediated transcriptional activation of the ALOX15 gene
High levels of UTX or MLL4 are associated with poor prognosis in patients with breast cancer.
A report of novel KDM6A mutations in patients with Kabuki syndrome.
One girl had a novel splice-site mutation in KDM6A.
Results show that UTX interacts with the retinoic acid receptor alpha (RARalpha) and this interaction is essential for proper differentiation of leukemic U937 cells in response to retinoic acid.

This study is the first to identify frequent BAP1 and BRCA pathway alterations in bladder cancer, show TERT promoter alterations are independent of other bladder cancer gene alterations, and show KDM6A loss is a driver of the bladder cancer phenotype.
Mutations in KMT2D gene were identified in 10/16 (62%) of the patients, whereas none of the patients had KDM6A mutations.
H3K27me3 demethylase UTX is a gender-specific tumor suppressor in T-cell acute lymphoblastic leukemia

Our results provide further support for the similar roles of KMT2D and KDM6A in the etiology of KS by using a vertebrate model organism to provide direct evidence of their roles in the development of organs and tissues affected in KS patients.
Kabuki syndrome may be caused by mutations in one of two histone methyltransferase genes: KMT2D and KDM6A.
The KDM6A gene is a histone demethylase specific for histone H3 Lysin 27 and regulates gene transcription [35]. In approximately 24% of urothelial carcinoma, KDM6A is altered.
UTX is a prominent tumour suppressor that functions as a negative regulator of EMT-induced Cancer Stem Cell-like properties by epigenetically repressing epithelial-mesenchymal transition -TFs.
Turner Syndrome subjects, who are predisposed to chronic ear infections, had reduced UTX expression in immune cells and decreased circulating CD4(+) CXCR5(+) T cell frequency.
The results define UTX as a bivalency-resolving histone modifier necessary for stem cell differentiation
UTX positively regulates E-cadherin expression in colon cancer cells.

Pathogenic variants in KMT2D resulting in protein truncation in 43% (6/14; of which 3 are novel) of all cases were detected, while analysis of KDM6A was negative. MLPA analysis was negative in all instances.
Mutations of the epigenetic genes KMT2D and KDM6A cause dysregulation of certain developmental genes and account for the multiple congenital anomalies of the syndrome
we identified a novel de novo deletion of KDM6A in a Chinese girl with KS. We consider her allergic skin manifestations to be part of the phenotypic spectrum of KS

Here, we discuss the roles of lysine 27 demethylases, JMJD3 and UTX, in cancer and potential therapeutic avenues targeting these enzymes. Despite a high degree of sequence similarity in the catalytic domain between JMJD3 and UTX, numerous studies revealed surprisingly contrasting roles in cellular reprogramming and cancer, particularly leukemia

Study presents a mutation screening of patients with Kabuki syndrome type 1 which identified 208 mutations in KMT2D. Two of the KDM6A mutations were maternally inherited and nine were shown to be de novo.
both UTX and UTY function as dose-dependent suppressors of urothelial bladder cancer development
Mutation in KDM6A gene is associated with cancer more frequently in males.
UTX gene expression in renal cell carcinoma and bladder cancer.

Kdm6a and Kdm6b were found to be significantly overexpressed in Malignant pleural mesothelioma (MPM) at the mRNA level. However, tests examining if targeting therapeutically Kdm6a/b using a specific small molecule inhibitor was potentially useful for treating MPM, revealed that members of the Kdm6 family may not be suitable candidates for therapy
inactivating mutations of KDM6A, which are common in urothelial bladder carcinoma, are potentially targetable by inhibiting EZH2.

Two novel missense mutations: p.G325A in the KDM6A gene responsible for Kabuki syndrome and p.G1877V in the SCN1A gene responsible for generalized epilepsy with febrile seizures plus were identified using the TruSight One sequencing panel.
Study identified a feed-forward loop between UTX and ER in the regulation of hormonally responsive breast carcinogenesis.
KDM6A and p21CIP1 expression are essential to curb E7 induced replication stress to levels that do not markedly interfere with cell viability
Rebalance of Histone h3 lysine 27 methylation 3 levels at specific genes through EZH2 inhibitors may be a therapeutic strategy in multiple myeloma cases harboring UTX mutations.
Data show that more mutations in the histone lysine demethylase KDM6A were present in non-invasive tumors from females than males.
Depletion of KDM6A inhibits the expression of SOX9, Col2a1, ACAN and results in increased H3K27me3 and decreased H3K4me3 levels.

High UTX expression is independently associated with a better prognosis in patients with esophageal squamous cell carcinoma (ESCC) and downregulation of UTX increases ESCC cell growth and decreases E-cadherin expression. Our results suggest that UTX may be a novel therapeutic target for patients with ESCC.

Study in Finnish Caucasian obesity patients demonstrated a different genome-wide DNA methylation pattern in autosomes and X-chromosome between males and females in human liver. Sex-specific differences in liver expression and methylation of KDM6A may contribute to higher HDL-cholesterol levels in females.
data suggest that haploinsufficiency for KDM6A due to mosaic X chromosome monosomy may be responsible for hyperinsulinism in Turner syndrome.

we retrospectively evaluated 100 infants with HI lacking a genetic diagnosis, for causative variants in KS genes.  Molecular diagnoses of KS were established by identification of pathogenic variants in KMT2D (n = 5) and KDM6A (n = 4).
ut of twenty-seven genes culminating into leading hubs in the network, we identified two key regulators (KRs) i.e. KDM6A and BDNF
Lymphomas with low UTX expression express high levels of Efnb1, and cause significantly poor survival.
The mutation pattern of KMT2D and KDM6A in a cohort of 505 patients clinically diagnosed as Kabuki syndrome was reported.
The histone demethylase UTX/KDM6A is mutated in up to 10% of cases of multiple myeloma, activating genes by removing the H3K27me3 repressive histone mark, counteracting EZH2 activity.

KDM6A exhibited essential roles in human PDAC as a tumor suppressor and KDM6A deficiency could be a promising biomarker for unfavorable outcome in PDAC patients and a potential surrogate marker for response to HDAC inhibitors.

Three of the 27 children had a KDM6A mutation and had thesame hypermobility as the KMT2D subjects. Only one of the Kabuki syndrome chil-dren had a patellar luxation in here previous history and was not con-sidered hypermobile using both scores.

Study shows that UTX and 53BP1 directly interact and co-occupy promoters in human embryonic stem cells and differentiating neural progenitor cells. Data suggests that the 53BP1-UTX interaction supports the activation of key genes required for human neurodevelopment.

In clear cell renal cell carcinoma, KDM6A(UTX) is one of the most frequently mutated genes; In 101 cases of patient samples, 12 samples contained KDM6A mutations. Other studies provided additional evidence that KDM6A was highly mutated in different human solid tumors and leukemias
the H3K27 histone demethylase KDM6A/UTX, but not its paralog KDM6B, is oxygen sensitive.
targeting the KDM6A-KLF10 feedback loop may be beneficial to attenuate diabetes-induced kidney injury.

UTY is co-regulated with KDM6A. UTY compensates for KDM6A in eutherian males and is responsible for the association between the loss of the Y chromosome and poor prognosis in a range of cancers. [review]
our findings highlight KDM6A as a novel mediator of drug resistance in acute myeloid leukemia
This article reviewed the most recent findings regarding cancer-specific metabolic reprogramming and the tumor-suppressive roles of IDH1/2, JARID1C/KDM5C and UTX/KDM6A. [review]
EZH2 methyltransferase and JMJD3/UTX demethylases were deregulated during hepatic differentiation of human HepaRG cells.
Expression of UTX Indicates Poor Prognosis in Patients With Luminal Breast Cancer and is Associated With MMP-11 Expression.
the X escapee Kdm6a regulates multiple immune response genes, providing a mechanism for sex differences in autoimmune disease susceptibility
Prenatal and perinatal history in Kabuki Syndrome.
GATA3 recruits UTX for gene transcriptional activation to suppress metastasis of breast cancer.
The phenotypic spectrum of Kabuki syndrome in patients of Chinese descent: A case series.

This study expands the number of naturally occurring KMT2D and KDM6A variants. The discovery of novel pathogenic variants will add to the knowledge on disease-causing variants and the relevance of missense variants in Kabuki syndrome.

Knock-out of KDM6s (JMJD3 and/or UTX) in human embryonic stem cells (hESCs) showed that KDM6s (JMJD3 and/or UTX)-deficient human ESCs exit pluripotency and commit to neural progenitor cells (NPC) differentiation normally, but the resulting NPCs fail to transit into neurons and glia due to a lack of accessibility at loci essential for neurogenesis.
Cancer-derived UTX TPR mutations G137V and D336G impair interaction with MLL3/4 complexes and affect UTX subcellular localization.
Coordinated demethylation of H3K9 and H3K27 is required for rapid inflammatory responses of endothelial cells.

Targeted inhibition of KDM6 histone demethylases eradicates tumor-initiating cells via enhancer reprogramming in colorectal cancer.

Loss of UTX/KDM6A and the activation of FGFR3 converge to regulate differentiation gene-expression programs in bladder cancer.

Histone demethylase UTX/KDM6A enhances tumor immune cell recruitment, promotes differentiation and suppresses medulloblastoma.

MF.term: RNA polymerase II cis-regulatory region sequence-specific DNA binding

name: lysine demethylase 6A
other_names: bA386N14.2 (ubiquitously transcribed X chromosome tetratricopeptide repeat protein (UTX))
ubiquitously transcribed tetratricopeptide repeat protein X-linked
ubiquitously-transcribed TPR gene on the X chromosome

kegg.name: Transcriptional misregulation in cancer - Homo sapiens (human)

reactome.name: Activation of anterior HOX genes in hindbrain development during early embryogenesis
Activation of HOX genes during differentiation
Chromatin modifications during the maternal to zygotic transition (MZT)

wikipathways.name: Pathways affected in adenoid cystic carcinoma

summary: This gene is located on the X chromosome and is the corresponding locus to a Y-linked gene which encodes a tetratricopeptide repeat (TPR) protein. The encoded protein of this gene contains a JmjC-domain and catalyzes the demethylation of tri/dimethylated histone H3. Multiple alternatively spliced transcript variants have been found for this gene. [provided by RefSeq, Apr 2014].
